excerpts.html: Quote: “It looks like there's a veritable blizzard of questions. That's always encouraging.” {attribution}
“Can you speak a little about samatha/vipassana and explain the difference between serenity and equanimity?” {attribution}
“Could you please explain about the death process…how quickly does rebirth occur?” {attribution}
“As a guilt-ridden American, how do you respond to personal mistakes without guilt?” {attribution}
“How would you describe the jhana states and do you teach this kind of meditation?” {attribution}

“When there is a lot of pain in the body, it is difficult to maintain “right effort,” yet sometimes through patient endurance the pain lessens or dissipates. Could you speak about right effort and the connection between right effort and samadhi?” {attribution}
“What is loving kindness? What is the body and mind’s experience when I feel metta for myself and others?” {attribution}
Quote: “I appreciate people's questions. I enjoy the questions, and I never quite know what's going to come out when people present a question. It's interesting to me as well.” {attribution}
“For me there appears to be a fine line between attention to the breath and controlling the breath. Is it like with quantum physics, just being aware changes the phenomena?” {attribution}

“What happens when someone carefully builds the fire, but it turns into a forest fire–uncontrollable–and the person experiences mania, delusions, and paranoia? What is the spiritual treatment?” {attribution}
